image.altText: A man wearing a light blue shirt and tie looks seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: NT Country Liberal Party MLA Joshua Burgoyne has pleaded guilty to one count of careless driving following a crash in Alice Springs last year.

title.children: Alice Springs politician fined after crash at 'notorious intersection'

image.altText: Composite image of four men and one woman. All are looking at the camera with neutral expressions.

props.synopsis: Four Corners talks to insiders in Israel's defence and intelligence establishment to challenge them about one of the most controversial wars in modern times.

title.children: Why is the most powerful army in the Middle East killing so many children? We ask some of Israel's leading voices

image.altText: Image of Princess Kate and her three kids smiling into the camera.

props.synopsis: Major news and photography agencies remove a photograph of the Princess of Wales, released by Kensington Palace, over doubts the image has been "manipulated".

title.children: Agencies issue 'kill' notice for 'manipulated' photo of Princess Kate

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: One of two teenage boys accused of killing Emma Lovell during a home invasion in 2022 has pleaded guilty to her murder.

title.children: Guilty plea for teenager accused of killing Emma Lovell

image.altText: Ryan Gosling performs 'I'm Just Ken'

props.synopsis: Christopher Nolan’s Oppenheimer wins Best Picture as Emma Stone’s Best Actress gong denies Lily Gladstone a historic win. Follow live.

title.children: Oppenheimer wins Best Picture as Emma Stone wins over Lily Gladstone in huge Oscars upset

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Emma Stone wins Best Actress for Poor Things
Christopher Nolan wins first Oscar for Best Director

image.altText: Emma Stone, Zendaya, Billie Eilish, and Margot Robbie on the Oscars red carpet

props.synopsis: Any red carpet event is sure to deliver high glamour, but the Academy Awards usually attracts elegant, somewhat understated looks from the celebrities who are expecting to win. Here are some of the looks we've seen.

title.children: Oscars red carpet: Margot Robbie avoids debuting a last pink Barbie number as celebrities gather for Hollywood's night of nights

image.altText: Ben Sears clenches both fists and yells in delight as teammates hug him

props.synopsis: The second Test in Christchurch is going down to the wire, with Australia and New Zealand fighting to get on top as the game reaches its climax. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Marsh and Starc gone in consecutive balls as second Test against New Zealand heads for thrilling finish

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: GOT HIM! TWO-IN-TWO! MITCH STARC IS OUT FOR A GOLDEN DUCK!
LBW! UP GOES THE FINGER! CAREY IS OUT! NO HE'S NOT!

image.altText: Young woman with long dark hair stands in front of parliament house wearing a navy jacket and arms crossed

props.synopsis: What were you doing at 19? Anjali Sharma is trying to change the law. Meet the teenager taking the fight for her generation's future from the streets to the halls of parliament.

title.children: Meet the teenager going toe-to-toe with pollies to pass a controversial law. Will she succeed?

image.altText: A collection of menstrual products.

props.synopsis: Taxes on imported fridges, pyjamas and even dodgem cars will be scrapped in a federal government bid to clear away "nuisances" for businesses.

title.children: Tampons, toothbrushes and toasters to have 'nuisance' tariffs cut

image.altText: People at a beach in the evening.

props.synopsis: Temperatures across Victoria will reach the high 30s for the third straight day in a run of March heat not experienced since the 1940s.

title.children: Victoria, Tasmania and parts of SA swelter through heatwave

image.altText: A boy smiling while sat in a ball pen

props.synopsis: The search for 12-year-old Hussein Al Mansoory has entered its third day, with police continuing their efforts to find the missing boy and imploring Auburn residents to keep an eye out.

title.children: Public urged 'maintain visual contact', not to approach 12yo boy still missing in Sydney's west

image.altText: A man leaning on a car.

props.synopsis: Nanda, who lives about 60km from Melbourne's CBD, says he's saved up to $6,000 a year thanks to switching to an electric car. He's part of a growing trend that has seen EV sales in outer suburbs boom as cost-of-living pressures bite.

title.children: Electric car sales are booming in Australia, but it's not where you think it is

image.altText: A woman pushes a shopping cart next to shelves of palm oil.

props.synopsis: Australia's neighbours have targeted palm oil, chicken wings, rice and other essentials to curb inflation. But experts say there's one thing the most successful responses have in common.

title.children: Australia's neighbours are winning their 'war' against inflation

image.altText: Fruit loops are being poured out of a see through packet into a white bowl.

props.synopsis: Deakin University researchers find seven cereal products have decreased in size but increased in cost, in an example of "shrinkflation". It comes as food policy experts warn against a suggestion that eating cereal for dinner is a solution to the cost-of-living.

title.children: Researchers find cereal shrinkflation hitting Australian consumers

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: All sectors are in the red as the local share market looks to head for its worst single-day loss in months, with losses across the board. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX down at lunch with losses across the board

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX tracking lower amid worst fall in months
Not just Australian shares in the red
ASX falls further than expected in early trade

image.altText: A man looks through large electrical wires inside a laboratory.

props.synopsis: As the take-up of bigger household solar systems steadily increases, are we nearing the point where too much power is being exported back to a grid?

title.children: Feeding solar back into the grid? Your days of getting paid for it might be numbered

image.altText: A man in high-vis steers a ride-on mower down a dusty street.

props.synopsis: Warren Acott, 66, was diagnosed with the condition seven months ago. From a pub in Victoria, he is taking a petition to Canberra in the hope of improving knowledge about the disease.

title.children: Truckie with motor neurone disease embarks on 800km lawnmower ride

image.altText: An iPhone with an Instagram post on the screen that reads "Share your secret crush story".

props.synopsis: Gabe Trew invited his social media followers to share their "secret crush story" to win a dream date just before February 14, and within 24 hours had received more than 2,000 confessions.

title.children: The average person keeps 13 secrets, five of which will never be shared

image.altText: A man waves the Palestinian flag in front of a crowd gathered on the steps of the Sydney Opera House.

props.synopsis: Some Labor insiders fear the relationship with Muslim and Arab communities is on the edge amid a growing perception the party has failed to respond to deep concerns about the war in Gaza. Elections in the US and UK suggest the ALP would be naive to ignore a potential backlash at the ballot box, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: Voters have punished Joe Biden over the war in Gaza. Is Anthony Albanese next?

image.altText: An elderly woman in a dress stands in front of her Newcastle home.

props.synopsis: In the wake of the 2022 east coast floods, there are signs some insurers may be considering making flood cover mandatory for new customers.

title.children: Penelope opted out of flood cover when her insurance skyrocketed by $14,000, but soon it may not be an option

image.altText: A young man in wetsuit and snorkelling gear stands in the water beside a young boy in swimming shorts and snorkel

props.synopsis: More than 10,000 people could be eligible for a compensation payout from the NSW government for the criminalisation of traditional fishing practices that are protected under Commonwealth native title law.

title.children: 'Chilling effect' on culture: Class action puts spotlight on prosecution of Aboriginal fishers

image.altText: Two emergency boats on a dam, over which flies a rescue helicopter.

props.synopsis: The man went overboard from a broken-down boat on Kinchant Dam on the weekend.

title.children: Father's body found in Queensland dam after two-day search

image.altText: Six men and two women in casual clothes stand in front of hay bales with a yellow  'Stop the Blue Heart project' poster

props.synopsis: Farmers and landowners claim a major local, state, and federal government project aimed at reducing flood risks could kill crops and breed swarms of mosquitoes spreading Ross River fever.

title.children: Farmers protest '$35 million swamp' as authorities progress controversial flood plan

image.altText: an illustration of a heritage house in black and white and a tree in colour

props.synopsis: The NSW government's reforms to rezone land near dozens of train stations to allow higher housing density take effect next month.

title.children: Sweeping changes to meet housing plans could change some of Australia's oldest suburbs forever

image.altText: a small blue sailing boat oored on very still water

props.synopsis: It's been a fixture of Hobart's northern suburbs since the 1970s, but the iconic "little blue boat" could be on the move after its owner makes the tough decision to part ways with his beloved vessel.

title.children: This little blue boat has been in the same spot for nearly 50 years, but a new beginning beckons

image.altText: Annemieke Mein pose with her sewing machine

props.synopsis: For many years, Annemieke Mein's art was dismissed as craft, but now the textile artist's work is the feature of a major exhibition celebrating the work she has created throughout her lifetime.

title.children: Annemieke Mein exhibition highlights artistic value of textile art

image.altText: Firefighters in two trucks battle an out of control bushfire at Grass Patch near Esperance

props.synopsis: The acting WorkSafe commissioner has confirmed a local government CEO could be personally charged with industrial manslaughter if volunteer firefighters are killed after concerns were raised following the death of a firefighter on the state's south coast.

title.children: Councils fear laws could see CEOs charged with industrial manslaughter over volunteer firefighter deaths

image.altText: A small girl  yells at the camera dressed in fur

props.synopsis: Cosplay fans joined Emil Minty who returned to the Far West NSW town where he starred as feral kid in Mad Max 2 to celebrate the movie with diehard movie fans from around the world.

title.children: Fans of post-apocalyptic Mad Max films head to tiny outback town where it all began
